item.title: Database Features in Rider
item.description: Rider provides robust support for working with databases directly within the IDE ‚Äì powered by DataGrip! Rider and DataGrip smooth development workflows by allowing you to manage and interact with a variety of database systems. This integration enhances productivity for developers who frequently work with data.¬†Database projects and connectivity There has long been support [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/17/database-features-in-rider/

item.title: How to Prepare for the Future of Programming
item.description: Start a start-up? Scratch that. Call your mom. Go back to school? Don‚Äôt go back to school. Learn to code? Don‚Äôt learn to code. Forget coding. Only prompt engineering matters now. Actually, I heard it‚Äôs overrated. You think we‚Äôre gonna be prompting in 5 years? 2 years? Nonsense. All this hype is being blown so [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/education/2025/11/17/how-to-prepare-for-the-future-of-programming/

item.title: Mark Your Calendars! Qodana Events in November
item.description: As 2025 starts racing to a close, the JetBrains Qodana team is ending the year with a series of events dedicated to what matters most in modern software development: secure workflows, high-quality code, and practical tooling that empowers developers to ship with confidence. Whether you‚Äôre working in security engineering, backend development, DevOps, or AI-powered applications, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2025/11/mark-your-calendars-qodana-events-in-november/

item.title: Why Diffusion Models Could Change Developer Workflows in 2026
item.description: Developers spend much of their time editing, refactoring, and debugging rather than producing entirely new code. Code creation tends to involve non-sequential back-and-forth refinement rather than typing out a complete function in one uninterrupted sequence. You might sketch a part, adjust parameters, skip ahead, then revisit earlier sections to refine them.¬†Diffusion models, and in [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/why-diffusion-models-could-change-developer-workflows-in-2026/

item.title: JetBrains Is Heading to VSLive! Orlando
item.description: Next week we‚Äôll be in Orlando, Florida for Visual Studio Live!, and if you work with .NET, we‚Äôd like to meet you. You‚Äôll find the JetBrains booth (#118) in the conference expo area throughout the week. Stop by to: We‚Äôll also have special offers available for those who visit the booth. Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/15/jetbrains-is-heading-to-vslive-orlando/

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA 2025.3 üíö Spring 7
item.description: Major Spring Framework releases don‚Äôt come around often ‚Äì and when they do, they tend to reshape how we build applications for years to come. Spring Framework 7 is one of those releases. It simplifies many aspects of development, cleans up some long-standing pain points, and introduces features that previously required custom annotations or boilerplate-heavy [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/11/intellij-idea-2025-3-spring-7/

item.title: Google Summer of Code 2025: What Our Contributors Built
item.description: Congrats to all GSoC 2025 contributors and mentors! item.title: What Developers Really Mean by ‚ÄúBad Code‚Äù
item.description: The phrase ‚Äúbad code‚Äù gets thrown around in reviews and online forums all the time. But what does it actually mean? It‚Äôs a good example of the vague terms that occasionally make the rounds in developer circles without much to qualify them.¬†We‚Äôve collected opinions on the subject, metrics, and code risks that you can [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2025/11/what-is-bad-code/

item.title: JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2025 Recordings Are Now Live
item.description: On November 5, 2025, we hosted the second annual JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf, a day dedicated to everything related to building, publishing, and growing plugins for JetBrains IDEs.Thank you to everyone who joined us live and helped make this year‚Äôs event even more interactive and inspiring than before! If you missed the live stream or [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2025/11/jetbrains-plugin-developer-conf-2025-recordings-are-now-live/

item.title: C# 14 Language Features in ReSharper and Rider 2025.3
item.description: Last year marked the first time we shipped ReSharper and Rider side by side with the official .NET SDK release ‚Äì and we‚Äôre happy to announce that we‚Äôve done it again with the 2025.3 release! Download Rider 2025.3 Download ReSharper 2025.3 With .NET 10 and C# 14, both ReSharper and Rider are ready on day [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/11/csharp-14-language-features-in-resharper-and-rider-2025-3/

item.title: What‚Äôs Been Fixed in Rider 2025.3
item.description: Each release of JetBrains Rider is shaped by an ongoing conversation between our team and our users. Your feedback, bug reports, and upvotes complement our internal QA processes and performance tracking, helping us understand how issues manifest across diverse environments and project setups. This collaboration allows us to prioritize the fixes that have the greatest [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/11/what-s-been-fixed-in-rider-2025-3/

item.title: ReSharper C++ 2025.3: C++26 Language Support, Faster Unreal Engine Startup, and Visual Studio 2026 Compatibility
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce that ReSharper C++ 2025.3 is here, bringing major language updates, performance improvements, and a refined UI in the upcoming Microsoft Visual Studio 2026 release. This version advances C++26 support with new language features, improves constexpr evaluation, and offers a refined Out-of-Process mode for smoother, more responsive performance. Unreal Engine developers will [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/rscpp/2025/11/11/resharper-cpp-2025-3/

item.title: ReSharper 2025.3: Day-One C# 14 Support, Visual Studio 2026 Compatibility, and Major Performance Gains
item.description: We‚Äôre pleased to announce the release of ReSharper 2025.3 in sync with .NET 10, continuing our tradition of releases that deliver day-one support for the newest C# language features. This version brings comprehensive C# 14 coverage, including extension members, extension operators, and user-defined compound assignment operators ‚Äì all ready to use as soon as you [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/11/resharper-2025-3-day-one-csharp-14-support-visual-studio-2026-compatible/

item.title: Rider 2025.3: Day-One Support for .NET 10 and C# 14, a New Default UI, and Faster Startup
item.description: Rider 2025.3 arrives alongside the .NET 10 SDK, continuing our commitment to day-one support for the latest .NET and C# features. This release brings full compatibility with .NET 10 and comprehensive support for C# 14, including extension members, extension operators, and user-defined compound assignment operators ‚Äì all ready to use from the moment you upgrade [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/11/11/rider-2025-3-day-one-support-for-dotnet-10/

item.title: Building AI Agents in Kotlin ‚Äì Part 1: A Minimal Coding Agent
item.description: Building agents is weird. You‚Äôre not writing code that does things. You‚Äôre writing code that gives an LLM the ability to do things, and the LLM decides what to do. What is an agent? An agent is an LLM that calls your functions in a loop until it decides the task is complete. That shift [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/building-ai-agents-in-kotlin-part-1-a-minimal-coding-agent/

item.title: JetBrains and DMCC AI Centre Announce Strategic Partnership to Accelerate AI Innovation
item.description: JetBrains and the DMCC AI Centre, a premier hub for artificial intelligence (AI) and innovation in the UAE, have announced a strategic collaboration to advance the growth of AI-driven innovation, entrepreneurship, and technical excellence within Dubai‚Äôs technology ecosystem. The agreement marks a key step in JetBrains‚Äô rapid expansion across the MENA region, as its local [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2025/11/11/jetbrains-and-dmcc-ai-centre-announce-strategic-partnership-to-accelerate-ai-innovation/

item.title: Rust vs. Python: Finding the right balance between speed and simplicity
item.description: This blog post was brought to you by Damaso Sanoja, draft.dev. Deciding whether to use Python or Rust isn‚Äôt just a syntax choice; it‚Äôs a career bet. According to the StackOverflow Developer Survey, Python dominates in accessibility, with 66.4% of people learning to code choosing it as their entry point. Python usage skyrocketed from 32% [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/rust/2025/11/10/rust-vs-python-finding-the-right-balance-between-speed-and-simplicity/

item.title: The Go Ecosystem in 2025: Key Trends in Frameworks, Tools, and Developer Practices
item.description: Go turns 16 this year. To celebrate this milestone, we have taken a closer look at the latest Developer Ecosystem Survey results and examined the evolution of the Go ecosystem over the past five years. According to JetBrains Data Playground, 2.2 million professional developers use Go as their primary programming language ‚Äì twice as many [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/go/2025/11/10/go-language-trends-ecosystem-2025/
